revision_history.draft:
The ocean hums in its kitchen,  
waves stir the pot of the deep,  
currents churn, digestive juices  
swallowing the moon’s silver.  

coral, a skeleton in the landfill,  
bleeds phosphorescence into the drain—  
we carve canals through its gut,  
map the ridges of its spine.  

salt crystals salt the air,  
a seasoning of the unknown.  
the sink overflows,  
a flood of unspooled silver.

final_poem:
The ocean hums in its kitchen,  
waves stir the pot of the deep,  
currents churn, digestive juices  
swallowing the moon’s silver light.  

Coral, a skeleton in the landfill,  
bleeds phosphorescence into the drain’s flow—  
we carve canals through its gut,  
mapping the ridges of its spine.  

Salt crystals salt the air,  
a seasoning of the unknown.  
The sink overflows,  
a flood of unspooled silver.
